data.title: Android game screen not aligned on top
data.body:
In the latest Ren'Py version (the nightly) the game screen on android aren't aligned on top, so the Android menu bar goes over the bottom of the game screen.
More info and screenshots (comparing it with older Ren'Py versions) in this thread:
https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=39324

data.title: Screens should take a layer property.
data.body: That gives the name of the layer the screen is shown on.

data.title: Gui Improvements
data.body:
Noted after trying to make a game with the new gui.
- [x] Background/Foreground should allow a list of possible choices, not just one. So we can have [ 'small_[prefix_]background.png', '[prefix_]background.png'  ]
- [x] Generate all buttons at 1:1 size, based on gui.button_size.
- [x] Radio and Check buttons checks should use foreground, not background.
- [x] Slider thumbs should be fixed-size images.
- [x] Generate slider images.
- [x] Generate slot images.
- [x] Integrate new image generation into the launcher.
- [x] OSHS should move to using tile for frame, button, bar backgrounds.
- [x] Ensure that code generation deals properly with ## Comments ##########
- [x] Handle choices as buttons.
- [x] Ensure all frames take tile.
- [x] Add NVL section to the variables section.
- [x] Recheck Docs.
- [x] Finish docs.
- [ ] Final check docs.

data.title: config.developer = "auto" allows the console to be used
data.body:
In 6.99.10.1227 the "config.developer" var is set to "auto". It's True when developing and False in a build. But it seems the console is allowed in the build (Shift + O) (not the other developer options).

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1102677/16190529/043165f2-36e0-11e6-805e-25e3123fa90b.jpg)

(It's not allowed if I add manually "config.developer = False" in options.rpy)

data.title: Doc still have 'config.translations' as a 'common used config var'
data.body:
https://www.renpy.org/doc/html/config.html#var-config.translations
Is this variable still used? Isn't it obsolete?

Also, the doc has the sentence: "See Localizing Ren'Py for how to use it, and here for a list of available translations.", without links (the links would be to the very old wiki, anyway).

data.title: Stuttering movement with overlapping textbuttons and focus_mask True
data.body:
Example code [here](http://pastebin.com/r5zzHZmP).

When moving, overlapping textbuttons are hovered with the mouse and `focus_mask True`, the movement of all buttons stutters quite badly, especially fullscreen.

Everything is smooth with `focus_mask None` or when the buttons do not overlap.

data.title: Support non-english script keywords.
data.body:
It would probably be valuable to allow other keywords to substitute for the default script language keywords - at least the most common ones. This would let us write

```
owshay eileen happy atray right ithway dissolve
```

instead of 

```
show eileen happy at right
```

The idea is that we should make it possible for people to enter common script code in their native language, especially if doing otherwise would require them to change keyboards. 

We should standardize the set of keywords on a per-language basis, so code can be shared within a language community. And it probably makes sense to only do this with buy-in from the main Ren'Py community for a language.

data.title: renpy.restart_interaction() doesn't work when rollback suspended
data.body:
```
<mercurytw> does renpy.restart_interaction() screw up suspend_rollback()
<mercurytw> it's not behaving the way I'm expecting it to. I suspend rollback before a heavily scripted sequence which calls restart_interaction() several times, then I un-suspend rollback after it's done. I was expecting that if I tried to rollback after the scripted section, it'd roll back to before the scripted section
<mercurytw> but it seems like it rolls back into the middle of the scripted section anyway
<mercurytw> I can just out-and-out block rollback, but that'd be a bad experience
```

Not sure how to fix this...  Pushing rollback info into a separate stack would complicate things badly.

data.title: renpy.call breaks Python loops
data.body:
If `renpy.call()` function is used inside python loop it breaks the loop. Exact behavior may vary depending on calling python code.

Example: 

``` renpy
init python:
    my_custom_list = [1,2,3]

label my_label(my_param):
    "in"
    $ renpy.say(None, "Inside: " + str(my_param))
    "out"

label start:
    "Start"
    python:
        renpy.say(None, "Python block start")
        for foo in my_custom_list:
            # Comment out the next line to let the for loop finish well
            renpy.call("my_label", foo)
            renpy.say(None, "Outside: " + str(foo))
        renpy.say(None, "Python block end")
    "End"
    return
```

This loop should call "my_label" 3 times. However it's executed only one time. All python code after the call is skipped.

Expected output:

```
Start
Python block start
in
Inside: 1
out
Outside: 1
in
Inside: 2
out
Outside: 2
in
Inside: 3
out
Outside: 3
Python block end
End
```

Actual output:

```
tart
Python block start
in
Inside: 1
out
End
```

data.title: doing a simple check for _from call duplicates?
data.body:
I think would be useful, during the Build phase, to do a simple check in the script for duplicate _from call labels.
Since having a duplicate can lead to some really weird bug that people might be unable to figure out (today just happened to me).
Doing duplicate labels is easier than it seems, editing an old game using copy/paste to copy block of texts for example ;)
So when you have time I think this should be a good idea and also probably reduce support :) thanks

data.title: Game autosaving on quit when config.autosave_on_quit = False
data.body: If the game is closed via the title bar (the cross button on top), the game always auto saves, no matter the value of autosave_on_quit.

- Also search in lib64 and lib32 for libraries

data.title: Easily set left_bar/right_bar/top_bar/bottom_bar to the same thing.
Strange text render behaviour on renpy version 6.99 and higher
data.body:
The problem occurs only when CTC definition is present in the narrator definition. So far it occured only on my PC.
OS: Windows 8.1
Video card: Intel(R) HD Graphics 4000 with last driver update

EN
[One](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3707285/15268783/400d0718-1a14-11e6-9de8-6a6e527c9f70.jpg) [Two](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3707285/15268785/4c44d57e-1a14-11e6-82b7-244a7b6d89bc.jpg)
RU
[One](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3707285/15268833/64b84058-1a16-11e6-9166-ea99a760d9f1.jpg) [Two](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3707285/15268837/67d09394-1a16-11e6-9e20-12b1451b9e2f.jpg) [Three](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3707285/15268838/696145a0-1a16-11e6-9a2c-3fff421052c1.jpg)

NVL screen:

``` python
screen nvl:
    window:
        background Frame(im.Alpha(_("gfx/ui/tbox3.png"),persistent.win['opacity']),0,0)

        xsize 680
        ysize 720

        left_padding 0
        right_padding 0
        top_padding 0
        bottom_padding 0
        left_margin 0
        right_margin 0
        xpos(persistent.win['xpos'])
        ypos(persistent.win['ypos'])
        xanchor(persistent.win['xanchor'])
        yanchor(persistent.win['yanchor'])

        has vbox

        $ i = len(dialogue)
        for who, what, who_id, what_id, window_id in dialogue:
            $ i -= 1
            window:
                xpos 50
                ypos 25
                xsize 580

                background None

                id window_id

                has hbox:
                    spacing 15

                if who is not None:
                    text who id who_id

                text (what) id what_id:
                    size 23
                    first_indent 10
                    line_spacing 5
                    if persistent.win['text_shade']:
                        if i == 0:
                            color "#FFF"
                            outlines [(1,"#000F",0,0),(1,"#000F",1,1)]
                        else:
                            color "#FFF8"
                            outlines [(1,"#0004",0,0),(1,"#0004",1,1)]
                    else:
                        color "#FFF"
                        outlines [(1,"#000F",0,0),(1,"#000F",1,1)]

    use quick_menu

    imagebutton id "hide":
        action HideInterface()
        idle _("gfx/ui/onscreen/hide_off.png")
        hover _("gfx/ui/onscreen/hide_on.png")
        xpos persistent.win['xpos'] + 620
        ypos 20
        xanchor 0.5
        yanchor 0.5
```

Narrator definition:

``` python
define narrator = Character(None, kind=nvl, ctc="wink")
```

CTC definition:

``` python
image wink = Animation("gfx/ui/wink/wink0.png", 0.1, "gfx/ui/wink/wink1.png", 0.1, "gfx/ui/wink/wink2.png", 0.1, "gfx/ui/wink/wink3.png", 0.1, "gfx/ui/wink/wink4.png", 0.1,  "gfx/ui/wink/wink5.png", 0.1, "gfx/ui/wink/wink6.png", 0.1, "gfx/ui/wink/wink7.png", 0.1, ypos =- 10)
```

CTC file [wink.zip](https://github.com/renpy/renpy/files/264531/wink.zip)

data.title: ScreenVariableInputValue Problem
data.body:
I have problem about ScreenVariableInputValue.
I tested it below screen.

```
screen navigation():
    default string = "test"
    # The background of the game menu.
    window:
        style "gm_root"
        if main_menu:
            add "images/system/title.png"

    # The various buttons.
    frame:
        style_group "gm_nav"
        xalign .98
        yalign .98

        has vbox

        textbutton _("Return") action Return()
        if _in_replay:
            textbutton _("End Replay") action EndReplay()
        textbutton _("Preferences") action ShowMenu("preferences")
        textbutton _("Save Game") action ShowMenu("save")
        textbutton _("Load Game") action ShowMenu("load")
        textbutton _("Main Menu") action MainMenu()
        textbutton _("Help") action Help()
        textbutton _("Quit") action Quit()
        input value ScreenVariableInputValue("string")
    key "game_menu" action Return()
```

data.title: Cannot perform data action with image button
data.body:
Hi, I apologize if this has been answered (in my defense I have been searching online for hours and have not found the answer).  I have an imagebutton and would like to have data action performed when it is clicked.  I can perform other actions such as Hide and Jump with no problem, however, the SetVariable action does not appear to do anything.  

I defined a variable to "count" thusly:
init python:
    showcompletion= False
    completion = 0
    def display_completion():
        if showcompletion:  
            ui.frame() #This is optional. It adds a frame around the text.
            ui.text("Completion: %d" %completion)
    config.overlay_functions.append(display_completion)

 I copied this directly from  https://www.renpy.org/wiki/renpy/doc/cookbook/Simple_Onscreen_Inventory to try to avoid issues.  

An example of my image button is:
    screen P_tube_options00:
        modal False
        imagebutton:
            xpos 0 ypos 500
            idle "idle.png"
            hover "hover_text.png"
            action [Hide("imagebutton")]
        imagebutton:
            xpos 180 ypos 180
            idle "blank.png"
            hover "hover.png"
            action [Jump("P_tube00_description"), SetVariable("completion",completion+1), SetVariable('T_options00a',True)]

I got this from https://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=8&t=9412 .

I have tried "clicked" instead of "action".  I have done just SetVariable("completion",completion+1) alone and just SetVariable('T_options00a',True) [I then set up an if statement, if blah == True: $completion+=1] alone, however, when I do showcompletion=True or just %(completion)d, it reads 0.  If I put $completion+=1 or even SetVariable("completion", completion+=1) into the imagebutton tabs, I get an error.  

I am sure this is very simple and I very sorry for wasting your time, but the help is greatly appreciated.  

Thanks.
